intro: Eriocaulon teusczii, commonly known as the narrowleaf spikerush, is a small herbaceous plant belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and dense clusters of small, spike-like flowers. Native to wetland and marsh environments, it thrives in moist, nutrient-poor soils. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters and has a compact, upright growth habit. Its reproductive structures are primarily wind-pollinated, which is common among members of the Cyperaceae family.
